content.content: Dai on Different Networks #7  If you missed last week’s update, here’s a link to Dai on Different Networks #6.  The Highlights  Avalanche’s Pangolin Exchange saw nearly 1.7 million DAI enter its network - representing over a 70% increase in DAI on the exchange. Over 33 million DAI moved to Klaytn following the announcement that it would be piloting the Bank of Korea’s CBDC. ApeSwap, UniSwap, and PolyCat continue to take root on Polygon (MATIC) with 104%, 49%, and 33% respective increases in circulating Dai. Polygon also announced its acquisition of Hermez, a ZK-based L2 solution.   Overview  Where is my Dai (General)  781×369 45 KB  This week’s overview shows very little movement, with only around 1% in total movement across all mediums. Source  Dai on Rollups     Rollup Solution Circulating Dai Weekly Movement     Optimism 3,831,025.16 5.19% decrease   Loopring 1,462,365.60 1.93% decrease   zkSync 803,236.24 1.18% increase   Aztec 2.0 35,338.65 15.87% increase   Hermez 10,853.06 0.00% increase    Source  Where is my Dai (L2s)  1023×375 21.5 KB  Source Special thanks to @SebVentures. Bookmark his site for accurate, easy-to-read tracking for Maker analytics of all kinds. Tokens Bridged by TVL  699×412 46.5 KB  This chart includes tokens across a number of chains, including Polygon, Loopring, Solana, Avalanche, Fantom, BSC, DeversiFi, Nerve, Harmony, RSK, Fuse, zkSync, OMG Network, Near, Aztec, Hermez, and Immutable X. I love that they took my suggestion into consideration!!! how great!
I had not noticed that he added loopring , it is incredible to see that there is no corner where DAI is not there.

really love this report. Can I ask in the first chart - where is my DAI?    Can you give me some idea of what the 49% is doing.? Also I am wondering in this weekly report can we get a report on the following: Maker protocol DAI interest earned for  the week? DAI borrowed? DAI repaid? and net DAI in the markets (DAI borrowed - DAI repaid). Since all DAI originates in main net vaults I think the key metric is to look at DAI generation as well as DAI payments.   Also since MakerDAO and MKR holders all benefit from DAI earned for the week this would be a nice graphic (weekly DAI earned)   Please and Thank you in advance. I know this isn’t DAI on Different networks so if there is another report with these numbers please point me to it.   If there is no such report please consider adding the above and changing this report to be a state of DAI in the World!

alec:  |Optimism|3,831,025.16|5.19% decrease   Is there any way to track the  DAI that left optimism? Did it leave Uniswap v3? Surprised to see folks move out with a 7-day waiting period. Also, would it possible to add Solana based dApps like SolApes? They’re moving DAI over via their wormhole bridge. If possible—if not no worries. Thanks I’m advanced!

Been wondering the same!  I’ll pass it along as soon as I find something on that front. As for Solana - look like they actually just updated their explorer to allow for token searches, so we got that going for us!  1155×425 26.7 KB  And here’s the top holder, but for the life of me - can’t find the project it’s tied to.  1118×65 3.77 KB
You the man Alec! If I was a betting man–I’d say it’s FTX. thanks again bud.

MakerMan:  Maker protocol DAI interest earned for the week? DAI borrowed? DAI repaid? and net DAI in the markets (DAI borrowed - DAI repaid).   Awesome feedback MM. We’ll need to up our game on the dashboards but these are great stats to look out for.

Just noticed I missed your top question! The ‘Other’ category is an aggregate of Aragon, PulseChain and Torando Cash. Lovin the suggestions, the SQLs a bit above me but trying to get some charts worked out with the team.

The ATRI token is run by Atari, the developer behind arcade classics like Pong, Pacman, and Tetris.  What Is Fantom (FTM)?  Explores the Fantom OPERA network and its DAG-based layer-1 blockchain.   Fantom is an algorithm belonging to the Byzantine Fault-Tolerant consensus that allows for honest nodes of a network to guarantee to agree on the timing and order of a set of transactions. This comes on the heels of a month-long surge that saw the revamped project overtake Aave as the top DAI holder on the Polygon chain. Aave now sits firmly as the largest DAI holder on the chain with over 175 million DAI or around 44% of Polygon’s total market share. In total, the chain’s seen around a 30% decrease in circulating DAI. Volmex Finance has expanded to Polygon.  Volmex is a derivates trading protocol that launched on the Ethereum network. Dai on Different Networks #8  If you missed last week’s update, here’s a link to Dai on Different Networks #7.  Highlights  Dai’s supply exceeds 6 Billion. Total Value Locked (TVL) reached an all-time high of 12.5 Million. Optimism has started to take hold. This week saw an increase of around 17% in circulating DAI, while Loopring’s supply decrease by nearly 60%. Venus, a stablecoin platform on BSC, saw an influx of nearly 7 million DAI this week, representing around a 46% increase in circulation. Solana added a token explorer! Around 12 million DAI has been bridged, 99.8% of which is held in one wallet. Charts tracking daily Dai transactions on DEXs and CEXs have been added.   Overview  Where is my Dai (General)  917×372 47.1 KB  This week’s overview again shows minimal movement, with increases of 3.4% between DEXs and Lending protocols and a 2.4% increase in ‘Other’. alec:  Avalanche     Top Holders Circulating Dai Proportion Weekly Movement     Pangolin 2,415,326.00 24.20% -41.24%   Other 7,563,560 75.80% 28.89%       Looks like DAI in Avalanche is picking up steam–Trader Joe alone has TVL of approx 29M DAI Total Avalanche TVL is on

You got me thinking… definitely weird that we’ve seen a solid chunk of internal movement on Avax, but total supply hadn’t moved in months. So, either token tracking is iffy or the user base is low, and since the C-chain is EVM compliant - it makes sense that it would grow first. Definitely did.     Solution Circulating Dai Dai Holders     Avalanche C-Chain 213,727,329.69 2,453   Avalanche P-Chain 0 0   Avalanche X-Chain 9,978,886.00 ?     The Contract (C) is EVM compliant, allowing for project copy/pasting for devs and easier bridging for end-users. Platform (P) chain controls validators and creates “subnets” or sharded side-chains The Exchange (X) chain is used for the creation and exchange of assets.  Nothing happening on P or X, but the C-chain is rolling. Found out DAI was originally bridged using the Avalanche Bridge and later replaced with the Avalanche-Ethereum Bridge (AEB), which added a mint-burn function to transfer ERC20 tokens, mint an on-chain equivalent (DAI.e), and burn the original token - meaning two ERC20 DAI exist on the chain.   Original Dai is sitting at around 1.25 million in circ supply and came through the first bridge.   Dai.e was bridged via the AEB and its circ supply is over 212 million.   Any chance you have some sources for wallet data? Not finding too much on individual holders, but some solid volume going through Pangolin.

Take a look at Markr I briefly navigated it–but could not figure it out–otherwise this here might be the key: https://cchain.explorer.avax.network/tokens/0xd586E7F844cEa2F87f50152665BCbc2C279D8d70/token-transfers DAI.e contract address   and totally – the $180M Avalanche incentive to move from Ethereum to Avax is working for those that don’t care for jpegs haha I believe Curve and AAVE will be on AVAX soon™
Alec that platform called “Benqi”  similar to what Compound does, has Benqi DAI (qiDAI) and approximately $1.8B in TVL. So, instead of cDAI, its qiDAI

alec:  12.5 Million.   Billion  Not so much DAI on Rollups yet but some movement to be sure… Interesting to see xDAI in the L2s… Hmm.  I keep wondering if we need to see DAI metrics as % of total float.  Numbers go up and down.  I keep thinking % of float may be just as important as raw TVL in $$. Weekly change in Tokens Bridged?   I’d like to see this as just a table of numbers with weekly changes noted.  That tells me more than the pie chart.    Another interesting look again isn’t as TVL in USD but in terms of % of MC of the token. I honestly am trying to fathom how BSC has so dang much TVL bouncing around.   There is so much I question about metrics in relation to BSC but I don’t have the time to deep dive into BSC.  It just sticks out as a quandry as to how they could get such a large TVL so fast… Interesting 16.5M on xDAI ‘unknown’ Thank you again for the report.  Always interesting.

Thanks for the catch! Yeah… been struggling with xDAI a bit. It’s definitely a sidechain - multi-sig bridge, governance token, unique dapps, the whole nine yards. But it also mostly functions as an ETH scaling solution and bridge to and from BSC. Idk, sort of a  hybrid between a block ecosystem and an L2 - kind of like Poly before it bought a zk? Either way, gonna take it out next week to zoom in on the Rollups! The TVL chart is from Etherscan and honestly doesn’t get updated enough. Working on getting that one migrated into Dune, and all in on adding % MC. With you on BSC - total circ has barely moved since I’ve been tracking it, but plenty of interchain activity… xDAI doesn’t have much for tracking. The only real sources are the total locked in the POA token bridge, HoneySwap’s metrics, and the Chai data from daistats… so definitely a work in progress. Appreciate the feedback!   I’ll do some digging into BSC and see what comes up!
But man… multi-chain’s already getting interesting. Need to get my A-Z Dai in line.

Multi-Chain News  Poly Network Hack On August 10th, Poly Network - not to be confused with Polygon (MATIC) - found itself the victim of a multi-chain hack that saw the loss of over $600 million in funds. The project was launched in August of 2020, with the backing of the teams behind NEO, Switcheo, and Ontology. The platform’s goal was to simplify the process of bridging and swapping tokens between several blockchain ecosystems including Binance, Ethereum, Polygon, NEO, Ontology, and HECO. For technical insight into the hack, read the Twitter thread below:  Ok here's how the Poly Network hack actually worked. If I'm reading the contracts correctly, it's pretty genius.— God-like Natural Number Creator Person (TM, R) (@kelvinfichter) August 10, 2021   DAOMaker Hack August 12th saw another hack, this time affecting DAO Maker, a crowdfunding platform running on the Ethereum network. The breach saw a loss of over $7 million. Per Decrypt, the attack was first reported by Wu Blockchain and was implemented using an exploit to access a company wallet with administrator privileges. Transactions per day   Its Governance token (STAKE) can be swapped to through numerous chains and DEXs, which makes the tracking of input DAI a challenge. STAKE’s top pair on HoneySwap is STAKE-xDAI with 312,307 in xDAI currently pooled, or a 3.7113% increase from last week.    556×536 34.2 KB   Current Events How xDai Will Adopt EIP-1559  When the transition happens, xDai transaction fees will be divided into priority fees and base fees. Priority fees will be sent to validators, and base fees will be burned. This means xDai will be burned on every block. The burn will create a mismatch between burned xDai and the Dai used to create xDai, which will still be locked in the bridge contract. To maintain token & bridge equilibrium, the extra Dai in the contract must also be reduced in the same exact proportions. The team is developing a mechanism to use the extra Dai to buyback-and-burn STAKE on Ethereum. This process will create a deflationary mechanism for STAKE with the aim of enhancing overall POSDAO security.   Bridges  https://omni.xdaichain.com/   Thoughts?
